name: GitHub Copilot
category: AI Tools / Code Assistant / Agent Platform
purpose: AI-powered code completion and autonomous agent for software development
description: GitHub Copilot is an AI pair programmer that offers autocomplete-style code suggestions and autonomous agent mode for multi-step development tasks. Features include code completions, Agent Mode for complex workflows, MCP server integration for external services, custom instruction generation, and configurable automation settings.

actual_remote_helpers_usage.primary_use: AI-assisted coding and autonomous development agent
use_cases: Code completion with ghost text suggestions
Autonomous feature development via Agent Mode
Database schema and API endpoint creation
External service integration via MCP servers

key_features.code_completions: Ghost text suggestions as you type code
key_features.mcp_integration: Connect to external services (GitHub, Notion, Stripe, etc.)
key_features.custom_instructions: Auto-generate project context from codebase analysis
key_features.chat_modes: Specialized behaviors (Beast Mode, DBA, Planning, etc.)
key_features.model_selection: Choose AI models (GPT-4.1, etc.) per task

agent_mode_capabilities.multi_step_execution: Handles complex features requiring 8+ implementation steps
agent_mode_capabilities.autonomous_coding: Writes, tests, and refactors code without constant approval
agent_mode_capabilities.external_integrations: Uses MCP servers to interact with APIs and services
agent_mode_capabilities.iterative_refinement: Incorporates user feedback to improve implementations
agent_mode_capabilities.planning_mode: Creates detailed implementation plans before coding
agent_mode_capabilities.tool_usage: Invokes appropriate tools for file operations, terminal commands, searches

mcp_server_ecosystem.available_servers: GitHub, Notion, Stripe, Zapier, Hugging Face, Azure DevOps, Memory, Firecrawl, Clarity
mcp_server_ecosystem.discovery: Browse MCP marketplace via VS Code Extensions
mcp_server_ecosystem.installation: 2-3 minutes per server via Extensions panel
mcp_server_ecosystem.tool_access: New tools immediately available in Agent Mode

configuration_best_practices.max_requests: Set to 100+ to prevent unnecessary interruptions
configuration_best_practices.allow_list: Add frequently used commands (npm install, npm test, dotnet build, etc.)
configuration_best_practices.deny_list: Block dangerous commands (rm -rf, force push, etc.)
configuration_best_practices.custom_instructions: Generate and update regularly as codebase evolves
configuration_best_practices.chat_modes: Install from awesome-copilot repo for specialized workflows

custom_instructions_generation.process: Click settings → Generate Instructions in Copilot chat
custom_instructions_generation.analysis: Scans entire codebase for architecture, conventions, workflows
custom_instructions_generation.content: Project overview, tech stack, architecture, coding conventions, setup instructions

strengths: Agent Mode enables autonomous multi-step development
MCP integration extends capabilities to external services
Custom instructions provide deep project context
Snooze feature for focused coding without distractions
Free for students, educators, and open-source maintainers
Active development with frequent feature updates
limitations: Agent Mode can run long without updates if max_requests set too high
MCP servers require individual setup per service
Code quality varies - always review AI-generated code
Some features still in experimental/preview stages
May suggest outdated patterns if not using latest model
Terminal command execution requires explicit approval unless on allow list

terminal_command_automation.allow_list: Commands that run automatically without approval
terminal_command_automation.location: VS Code Settings → Extensions → GitHub Copilot → Experimental
terminal_command_automation.safety: Only add trusted, non-destructive commands to allow list

use_cases: Build complete web application from high-level prompts
Generate REST API endpoints with authentication
Implement UI components with styling (React, Vue, etc.)
Debug complex issues with AI assistance
Document code with inline comments and README files
Integrate external services via MCP servers
